result.execSummary:
The defendant Chase Gerald Kohl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chase Gerald Kohl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chase Gerald Kohl was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Ct#2,#3,#4 in 14CF87 and to the extended supervision now serving.

records.addlTxt: 10:39  Defendant Chase Gerald Kohl in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  Defendant Chase Gerald Kohl in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie - Plead to Ct 2 and dismiss Ct 1.  30 days jail conc to 14CF87 sentence.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 2    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 2 disorderly conduct.  Dismiss Ct 1.. Court orders 30 days jail conc to sentence in 14CF87 and to the extended supervision now serving on the revocation. C t 1 is dismissed.
